meta_data.title: The Beginning of the White Letters on the Black Screen
meta_data.subtitle: ESTHER 9:20-22 Thanks to everyone who supports TMBH at  You're the reason we can all do this together!  Opening song, "" from the album, "" by

transcription_data.text: the whatever watch movie that has any kind of basis in reality we get to the end and i have this situation that develops my car right there's a deal movie you are either gonna give me the black screen with the white letters on it that tells me what happened next in everybody's life or i'm googling this thing right now i will do it gimme the thing i want pictures of the actual people right next to the actors who portrayed them so i can be like i look what you did there you've got that polo shirt just right and i wanna know what happened i'm gonna sit here through the credits not gonna watch you made this movie google all the details we can get one of those black screens with white letters over the top here at the end of ester where the drama stuff is really played out and now we're into mop up wrap up but oh wow i gotta be careful that makes it sound like you shouldn't listen anymore for the next couple of weeks like well you know we're just i mean all the fun is over now we're into this stupid boring wrap up stuff no it's not like that at all i think we're gonna do the wrap up stuff the home stretch the rest chapter nine and into chapter ten probably today and tomorrow ish and then that's it then we gotta go and we gotta think about what we just read and we gotta find out what happened everybody after the book of ester is over we got a few other things that we got to reflect on regarding the themes in this book and ultimately we still gotta take a minute and think about what we do with this is there anything that in a practical sense you're supposed to take from this that you know you do differently with your life not sure i've decided one way or another on that yet but we're gonna get taller that still but today represents the beginning of the white letters on the black screen talking about how stuff played out and it goes thusly ester nine verse twenty more to kai recorded these events wait why am i using this voice is wrong voice all right come on women you got this white letters on black screen voice and mortik i recorded these events and he sent letters to all the jews throughout the provinces of king Xerxes near and far to have them celebrate annually the fourteenth and fifteenth days of the month of a dar as the time when the jews got relief from their enemies and as the month when their sorrow was turned into joy and their morning into a day of celebration he wrote them to observe the days as days of feasting and joy and giving presence of food to one another and gifts to the poor that might have been too much that was too much i haven't earned that kind of seniority in my voice yet i got a age more i gotta achieve more things you get the idea it's clearly shifted into wrap-up tone right all these details mortik i sent out to everybody and in saying that the author of ester is telling us a little bit about how they learned these details mortik i is one of the sources on all of this stuff you got that right he's explaining how all these things in the citadel happened because how else would everybody know and so presumably then by the time the book of ester as we are reading it was in the hands of the original audience they already had this account they had the mortik i letters version of this and so in that respect maybe we get a tiny little bit of an answer as to who wrote this book it was at least sort of mortik i that indicates to me that there was i guess what maybe we would call a proto ester which is this letter that he sent out no doubt everybody hung on to that letter because we've seen earlier in asra and nea mia that you know ever want to lose some sort of document or edict that comes from the throne or from the king's visea because of the next guy might not remember that at all but you can always point to that and be like nope it's good for the goose good for the gander the things here they're binding in purge if the king says it it can't be unsaid and this is the story and this got sent out and so they would have cherished this proto ester and it makes sense then why every year in commemoration of poor them the original audience members would have read that letter from mortik i before they ever even had this version of the book the fully developed rounded out version that you and i are looking at now they would have read that as a recitation of this to make it clear to their friends and would be enemies and local bureaucrats and rulers and throne appointed susa appointed types who are out here hanging out with the provincials to make it clear to everybody hey this is what happened and this was all ordained by the king of kings king's xerxes this is what went down let us never forget that this is the deal and in just then as a matter of practice of reciting this they are taking steps to prevent something like this from happening again and they're also taking steps to share a battle story to share a thing that they have in common that they've all gone through together this horrible ordeal and trial and think about the effect that this would have had it would have been this great unifying thing after the jews are scattered to the four winds because the jews who went back to rebuild clear back under the reign of syrus in the five thirties bc i mean at the time that this letter goes out from mortik i it's like a lifetime it goes at 70 years 60 years something like that people would have forgotten they would have died and a lot of the people who now lived in jerusalem they never would have lived in susa they never would have lived in percha i mean if you're 58 years old or younger you've never been to percha you've never been to susa or perceptible or babylon or any of these places you're just from jerusalem and you don't feel a lot of connection after all those years with the jews your distant cousins who still live clear back east in susa but now a story is unfolded where the jews and the provinces and the jews in the home office in susa they all banded together and won a great victory together even though they weren't on the same local battlefield at the same time they rallied together and they did a thing and they defeated their enemies everywhere and the jews and the provinces by their actions they propped up and they took care of and they had the backs of the jews and the seat of power in susa and so there would have been this new found collegiality that would have happened this is sort of the first emulsifying calcifying the first gelling event of this new jewish reality this new jewish diaspora or chapter in the diaspora the scattering of the jews where you got a whole bunch of people who chose not to go and rebuild the temple and eventually rebuild the walls no they chose to sit tight in what they knew in the Persian territory but you got a whole bunch who did go and rebuild and you got their descendants and maybe they've drifted well not anymore because of the public reading of this thing every year they celebrate how it doesn't matter if we live here or over there we have this passport or that passport we are distinct people with a distinct history and we are jews whether we live in susa or whether we live in jirousalam and worship and sacrifice at the actual temple of god in that place and so there's this very important function that i think this reading would have provided and it's no wonder to me that this is persisted all the way to this day this habit of reading the story of ester out loud and i think it's really interesting to note too that mortik i recorded all this and he sent letters out to all the jews throughout the provinces and before there even was an ester in this form to read aloud in celebration of porum certainly they were reading aloud and cherishing the story as relayed by mortik i himself pretty dang cool and i also appreciate that it looks like mortik i specifically spelled out what the theme of this story is going to be or obviously as it's reversal that the sorrow was turned into joy and the mourning was turned into celebration that isn't something that got added on after the fact according to the text here that's something that was baked in to this celebration from the very beginning with the very first recording of what happened at the very first publishing of these events which according to the text happened at the desk of mortik i and came from the pen of mortik i himself i think we should not underestimate how important and impactful this first little set of white letters on a black screen at the end of the story i don't think we should underestimate how important that is i think that is going to cast a very long shadow in a good way into the stuff that happens after the book of ester and all the way up till today and we will keep looking on these white words on the black screen at the end of the dramatic part of the book of ester next time around final thing as we're wrapping up here it's a quick reminder that we're only a few days away from me getting my grubby mitts on those boxes of field notes books that say nia mia on them that we're going to send out in anticipation of our next season our next series which is on the book of nia mia it keeps us in this era it's going to help us get a sense of how the ester story plays out in the coming decades and how that shapes the world into which jesus of nazareth walks a few centuries down the road from the era we've been looking at it's going to be a great series it's going to be super awesome super excited about it of course i'm all of those things why would i be doing it if i weren't those things but these books i changed the design a little bit i think they look really sharp i think i said field guide yesterday when i was talking about it should be field notes or field notes i didn't write things in it you're the one who gets to write the things in it whatever you want is a benchmark some sort of indicator of the progress that you are making as you are taking books of the bible and making a habit every day of hanging out with me to get that in your hip pocket and the book helps you commemorate that it helps you literally and figuratively keep these books of the bible in your hip pocket and order your thoughts and really have ownership over the progress you're making on the bible and so i am super excited here in just a few days to send those out to everyone who is supporting at any level in any way on any platform thank you so much this podcast exists because y'all do that so i will keep you posted on mailing day but there's still time to jump in there and be on that list so again whoever we have with an up-to-date address on file the day those come in we're gonna print labels and we're gonna mail them to you that day and that will be our list okay that was a lot of stuff i'm matt this is a 10-minute bible hour podcast let's do this again soon you you
